meanings.definition: Of or relating to an ostiole.
meanings.sent1: The ostiolar opening allowed the fruit to ripen.
meanings.sent2: The ostiolar structure was essential for the plant's reproduction.
meanings.sent3: The ostiolar entrance was so tiny that only a small insect could fit through.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like ostiolar gates, revealing her inner thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The ostiolar connection between the two worlds was fragile yet crucial.

meanings.sent1: The ostiolar fruits were easily identifiable in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The tree was ostiolar, bearing numerous small openings for seeds to disperse.
meanings.sent3: The ostiolar tree seemed to be playing hide-and-seek with the birds.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an ostiolar maze, full of hidden passages and surprises.
meanings.sent5: The ostiolar branches reached out like welcoming arms to the passing animals.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or resembling an ostiole.
meanings.sent1: The ostiolar shape of the flower attracted pollinators.
meanings.sent2: The ostiolar color of the mushroom indicated its maturity.
meanings.sent3: The ostiolar pattern on the fabric looked like tiny doorways to a magical land.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had an ostiolar quality, drawing everyone closer.
meanings.sent5: The ostiolar design on the vase was intricate and beautiful.
